member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartPortionFormat
member.summary: This class contains the text portion formatting properties used in charts. Unlike , all properties of this class are writeable.

remarks.para: This class is used to return and manipulate text portion formatting properties defined for the particular portion. This means that no inheritance is applied when getting values so for the majority of cases you will get values meaning "undefined".
In order to get the effective formatting parameter values including inherited you need to use method which returns a instance.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.SeriesGroups
member.summary: Gets the groups of series.
member.remarks:
1) Each group of series contains series with combinable types. Groups of combinable series types defined and described with CombinableSeriesTypesGroup enum. Also each group of series contains series witch is plotted whether on primary axes or on secondary axes (not both cases in one group). So, principle of series grouping is a grouping by type groups mentioned above and by primary/secondary plotting type.
2) Group of series contains some series properies whitch is common for each series in group ("series group properties"). "Series group properties" in ChartSeriesGroup class is read/write. Each of "series group properties" can have a read-only projection in ChartSeries class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.TrendLines
member.summary: Collection of series trend lines.
member.remarks: TrendLines are available (not null) for data series in unstacked 2-D area, bar, column, line, stock, xy (scatter), and bubble charts. A trendline are not available for data series in any chart type that is stacked or 3-D. Trendlines are also not available for radar, pie, surface, or doughnut charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.ErrorBarsXFormat
member.summary:
Represents ErrorBars of series with derection X.
ErrorBars with X direction are avalible for series of type area, bar, scatter and bubble. For any other types of chart this property returns null (including 3D charts). In case of custom values use DataPoints collection to specify value (with property).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.ErrorBarsYFormat
member.summary:
Represents ErrorBars of series with derection Y.
ErrorBars with Y direction are avalible for series of type area, bar, line, scatter and bubble. For any other types of chart this property returns null (including 3D charts). In case of custom values use DataPoints collection to specify value (with property).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.Bar3DShape
member.summary: Specifies the shape of a series of a 3-D bar chart. Changing of value of this property can cause to automatically changing Type of series.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.InvertIfNegative
member.summary: Specifies the bar, column or bubble series shall invert its colors if the value is negative.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.HasUpDownBars
member.summary: Determines whether Line- or Stock-chart has a up/down bars. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars.HasUpDownBars read/write property for change value. Use ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars property for format up/down bars.
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars.HasUpDownBars.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.GapWidth
member.summary: Specifies the space between bar or column clusters, as a percentage of the bar or column width. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.GapWidth read/write property for change value.
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.GapWidth.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.GapDepth
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance, as a percentage of the marker width, between the data series in a 3D chart. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.GapDepth read/write property for change value.
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.GapDepth.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.Overlap
member.summary: Specifies how much bars and columns shall overlap on 2-D charts (from -100 to 100). This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.Overlap read/write property for change value.
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.Overlap.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.HasSeriesLines
member.summary: Determines whether there are series lines for this series and kindred series. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.HasSeriesLines read/write property for change value. Use ParentSeriesGroup.SeriesLinesFormat property for format series lines.
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.HasSeriesLines.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.IsColorVaried
member.summary: Specifies that each data marker in the series has a different color. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.IsColorVaried read/write property for change value.
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.IsColorVaried.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabel.Hide
member.summary: Make data label hidden by setting all Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) to false state. IsVisible will be false after this.
member.remarks: If data label is not visible (IsVisible is false) you can make data label visible with setting Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) to true state.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabel.AddTextFrameForOverriding(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize TextFrameForOverriding with the text in paramener "text". If TextFrameForOverriding is already initialized then simply changes its text.
member.param: Text for a new TextFrameForOverriding.

member.summary: Returns the parent chart. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabel.IsVisible
member.summary: False means that data label is not visible (and so all Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) are false).
member.remarks: If data label is visible you can make it hidden with Hide() method. But if data label is not visible (IsVisible is false) you can make data label visible with setting Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) to true state.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabel.TextFrameForOverriding
member.summary: Can contain a rich formatted text. If this property is not null then this formatted text value overrides auto-generated text of data label. Auto-generated text of data label means text that is managed by ShowSeriesName, ShowValue, ... properties and is formatted with the TextFormatManager.TextFormat property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelCollection.Hide
member.summary: Make data label hidden by default by setting all Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) of the DefaultDataLabelFormat property to false state. IsVisible will be false after this.
member.remarks: If data label is not visible by default (IsVisible is false) you can make data label "visible by default" with setting Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) of the DefaultDataLabelFormat property to true state.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelCollection.Delete
member.summary: Returns or sets delete flag. True means that data label is not visible by default (and so all Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) of the DefaultDataLabelFormat property are false).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelCollection.IsVisible
member.summary: False means that data label is not visible by default (and so all Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) of the DefaultDataLabelFormat property are false).
member.remarks: If data label is visible by default you can make it hidden by default with Hide() method. But if data label is not visible by default (IsVisible is false) you can make data label "visible by default" with setting Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) of the DefaultDataLabelFormat property to true state.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Backward
member.summary: Specifies the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trend line extends before the data for the series that is being trended. On scatter and non-scatter charts, the value shall be any nonnegative value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Forward
member.summary: Specifies the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trendline extends after the data for the series that is being trended. On scatter and non-scatter charts, the value shall be any non-negative value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Intercept
member.summary: Specifies the value where the trendline shall cross the y axis. This property shall be supported only when the trendline type is exp, linear, or poly.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.DisplayEquation
member.summary: Specifies that the equation for the trendline is displayed on the chart (in the same label as the Rsquaredvalue).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Order
member.summary: Specifies the order of the polynomial trend line. It is ignored for other trend line types. Value must be between 2 and 6.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Period
member.summary: Specifies the period of the trend line for a moving average trend line. It is ignored for other trend line variants. Value must be between 2 and 255.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.DisplayRSquaredValue
member.summary: Specifies that the R-squared value of the trendline is displayed on the chart (in the same label as the equation).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.TextFrameForOverriding
member.summary: Can contain a rich formatted text. If this property is not null then this formatted text value overrides auto-generated text of data label. Auto-generated text of data label means text that is managed by ShowSeriesName, ShowValue, ... properties and is formatted with the TextFormatManager.TextFormat property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified layout slide to the end of the collection.
member.param: Slide to clone.
member.remarks: 1) New layout will be linked with parent master slide for this layout slides collection. So this is analogue of copy/paste with "Use Destination Theme" option in PowerPoint. 2) Analogue of this method is method accessed with property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.InsertClone(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of a specified layout slide to specified position of the collection.
member.param: Index of new slide.
Slide to clone.
member.remarks: New layout will be linked with parent master slide for this layout slides collection. So this is analogue of copy/paste with "Use Destination Theme" option in PowerPoint.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.Add(Aspose.Slides.SlideLayoutType,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new layout slide to the end of the collection.
member.param: Layout type for a new layout. Supported layout types: Title, TitleOnly, Blank, TitleAndObject, VerticalText, VerticalTitleAndText, TwoObjects, SectionHeader, TwoTextAndTwoObjects, TitleObjectAndCaption, PictureAndCaption, Custom. Other layout types are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.

Name for a new layout. If passed name is already in use the ArgumentException will be thrown. If null parameter is passed then name genarated atomatically in regards to passed layout type (for example "Title Slide" or "1_Title Slide", "2_..", etc.).
member.exception: Thrown if unsupported value of parameter is passed. Layout types that are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.
Thrown if layout name value is already in use in this collection of the layouts.
member.remarks: 1) Added layout for value SlideLayoutType.Custom of contains no placeholders and no shapes. 2) Analogue of this method is method accessed with property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.Insert(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.SlideLayoutType,System.String)

Name for a new layout. If passed name is already in use the ArgumentException will be thrown. If null parameter is passed then name genarated atomatically in regards to passed layout type (for example "Title Slide" or "1_Title Slide", "2_..", etc.).
member.exception: Thrown if unsupported value of parameter is passed. Layout types that are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the element at the specified index of the collection.
member.param: The zero-based index of the element to remove.
member.exception: Thrown if layout is used in presentation (its HasDependingSlides property is true).
member.remarks: 1) To avoid throwing of the PptxEditException check layout's HasDependingSlides property before. 2) You can use also method to simplify code.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.GlobalLayoutSlideCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of all layout slides in presentation. Extends LayoutSlideCollection class with methods for adding/cloning layout slides in context of uniting of the individual collections of master's layout slides.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.GlobalLayoutSlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified layout slide to the presentation.
member.param: Slide to clone.
member.remarks: When cloning a layout between different presentations layout's master can be cloned too to keep source formatting. Internal registry is used to track automatically cloned masters to prevent creation of multiple clones of the same master slide. Manual cloning of master slides will be neither prevented nor registered.

member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified layout slide to the presentation.
member.param: Slide to clone.
Master slide for a new layout.
member.remarks: 1) New layout will be linked with defined master in destination presentation. So this is analogue of copy/paste with "Use Destination Theme" option in PowerPoint. 2) Analogue of this method is method accessed with property.

member.exception: Thrown if unsupported value of parameter is passed. Layout types that are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.

member.summary: Returns or sets format of a presentation to load. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets Regular font used in case source font is not found.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.DefaultSymbolFont
member.summary: Returns or sets Symbol font used in case source font is not found.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.OnlyLoadDocumentProperties
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation file is password protected. Value of true means that only document properties must be loaded from an encrypted presentation file and password must be ignored. Value of false means that entire encrypted presentation must be loaded with use of right password. If presentation isn't encrypted then property value is always ignored. If document properties of an encrypted file aren't public and property value is true then document properties cannot be loaded and exception will be thrown.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.WarningCallback
member.summary: Returns or sets an object which receives warnings and decides whether loading process will continue or will be aborted. Read/write .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.BiLevel
member.summary: Represents a Bi-Level (black/white) effect. Input colors whose luminance is less than the specified threshold value are changed to black. Input colors whose luminance are greater than or equal the specified value are set to white. The alpha effect values are unaffected by this effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.HtmlOptions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Returns or sets a value determining the quality of the JPEG images inside PDF document.

remarks.p: Has effect only when a document contains JPEG images.

Use this property to get or set the quality of the images inside a document when saving in PDF format. The value may vary from 0 to 100 where 0 means worst quality but maximum compression and 100 means best quality but minimum compression.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.summary: Specifies compression type to be used for all textual content in the document.
member.remarks: Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.EmbedTrueTypeFontsForASCII
member.summary: Determines if Aspose.Slides will embed common fonts for ASCII (33..127 code range) text. Fonts for character codes greater than 127 are always embedded. Common fonts list includes PDF's base 14 fonts and additional user specified fonts.
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.AdditionalCommonFontFamilies
member.summary: Returns or sets an array of user-defined names of font families which Aspose.Slides should consider common.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.EmbedFullFonts
member.summary: Determines if all characters of font should be embedded or only used subset.
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Returns or sets a value determining the quality of the JPEG images inside PDF document.

remarks.p: Has effect only when a document contains JPEG images.

Use this property to get or set the quality of the images inside a document when saving in PDF format. The value may vary from 0 to 100 where 0 means worst quality but maximum compression and 100 means best quality but minimum compression.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.Compliance
member.summary: Desired conformance level for generated PDF document.
member.remarks: Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.Password
member.summary: Setting user password to protect the PDF document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.SaveMetafilesAsPng
member.summary: True to convert all metafiles used in a presentation to the PNG images.
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.SufficientResolution
member.summary:
Returns or sets a value determining resolution of images inside PDF document.
Property affects on file size, time of export and image quality.
The default value is 96.Effect of this parameter depends on few factors. Algorithm tries to get best output image size according to the property value, source image size and image frame size. Using of similar property values may give the same result. Recommended to use step 16 or 32 to get visible effect.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Import.HtmlExternalResolver
member.summary: Callback object used by HTML import routine to obtain referrenced objects such as images. Supports "data:" "file:" and "http:" url schemes. Using this resolver could create a vulnurability when client provided HTML file will make server software to obtain local or network file. Use with caution. It is recommended not to specify HtmlExternalResolver at all (only embedded objects will be read) or create some subclass which checks if specified uri is valid.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Import.HtmlExternalResolver.ResolveUri(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Resolves URI.
member.param: absolute URI of linking objects
URI to the linked object.
member.returns: absolute URI to the linked object. Returning null will prevent object from loading.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Import.HtmlExternalResolver.GetEntity(System.String)
member.summary: Fetches linked object.
member.param: Absolute URI to the object (returned by method.
member.returns: object with the linked object data or null if object can't or shouldn't be loaded.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.ResetLicense
member.summary: Reset the license
member.remarks: Use this method to reset license in component

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.IsLicensed
member.summary: Check if licence is applied to component
member.returns: True if component is licensed, otherwise false

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Animation.Point.Formula
member.summary:
Formulas within values, from, to, by attributes can be made up of these: Standard arithmetic operators: ‘+’, ‘-‘, ‘*’, ‘/’, ‘^’, ‘%’ (mod) Constants: ‘pi’ ‘e’ Conditional operators: ‘abs’, ‘min’, ‘max’, ‘?’ (if) Comparison operators: '==', '>=', '', '!=', '!' Trigonometric operators: ‘sin()’, ‘cos()’, ‘tan()’, ‘asin()’, ‘acos()’, ‘atan()’ Natural logarithm ‘ln()’ Property references (host supported properties)
for example: "#ppt_x+(cos(-2*pi*(1-$))*-#ppt_x-sin(-2*pi*(1-$))*(1-#ppt_y))*(1-$)" Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets a normal vector. To be more precise, this attribute defines a vector normal to the face of the backdrop plane. Vector represented by array of 3 float values which define X, Y and Z coordinates.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Backdrop3DScene.AnchorPoint
member.summary: Returns or sets a point in 3D space. This point is the point in space that anchors the backdrop plane. 3D point represented by array of 3 float values which define X, Y and Z coordinates.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Backdrop3DScene.UpVector
member.summary: Returns or sets a vector representing up. To be more precise, this attribute defines a vector representing up in relation to the face of the backdrop plane. Vector represented by array of 3 float values which define X, Y and Z coordinates.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.ParagraphFormat
member.summary: This class contains the paragraph formatting properties. Unlike , all properties of this class are writeable.

remarks.para: This class is used to return and manipulate paragraph formatting properties defined for the particular paragraph. This means that no inheritance is applied when getting values so for the majority of cases you will get values meaning "undefined".
In order to get the effective formatting parameter values including inherited you need to use method which returns a instance.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.PortionFormat
member.summary: This class contains the text portion formatting properties. Unlike , all properties of this class are writeable.

remarks.para: This class is used to return and manipulate text portion formatting properties defined for the particular portion. This means that no inheritance is applied when getting values so for the majority of cases you will get values meaning "undefined".
In order to get the effective formatting parameter values including inherited you need to use method which returns a instance.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Presentation.EncryptDocumentProperties
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation is password protected. If true then document properties is encrypted in presentation file. If false then document properties is public while presentation is encrypted.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Presentation.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is encrypted.
member.value: true if presentation was loaded from encrypted file or method was called ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Presentation.IsOnlyDocumentPropertiesLoaded
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation file is password protected and document properties of this file are public. Value of true means that only document properties are loaded from an encrypted presentation file without use of password. Value of false means that entire encrypted presentation is loaded with use of right password, not only document properties are loaded. If presentation isn't encrypted then property value is always false. If document properties of an encrypted file aren't public then property value is always false. If Presentation.EncryptDocumentProperties is true than IsOnlyDocumentPropertiesLoaded property value is always false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ISlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified slide to the end of the collection.
member.param: Slide to clone.
member.remarks: When cloning a slide between different presentations slide's master can be cloned too. Internal registry is used to track automatically cloned masters to prevent creation of multiple clones of the same master slide. Manual cloning of master slides will be neither prevented nor registered. If you need more control over cloning process use or for cloning slides, or for cloning layouts and for cloning masters.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ISlide,Aspose.Slides.IMasterSlide,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified source slide to the end of the collection. Appropriate layout will be selected automatically from the specified master (appropriate layout is the layout with the same Type or Name as of layout of the source slide). If there is no appropriate layout then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.param: Slide to clone.
Master slide for a new slide.

If there is no appropriate layout in specified master then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.exception: Thrown if there is no appropriate layout in specified master and allowCloneMissingLayout is false.

member.summary: Set or returns sound mode for slide transition.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.BuiltInSound
member.summary: Specifies whether or not this sound is a built-in sound. If this attribute is set to true then the generating application is alerted to check the name attribute specified for this sound in it's list of built-in sounds and can then surface a custom name or UI as needed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.SoundLoop
member.summary: This attribute specifies if the sound will loop until the next sound event occurs in slideshow.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.AdvanceOnClick
member.summary: Specifies whether a mouse click will advance the slide or not. If this attribute is not specified then a value of true is assumed

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.AdvanceAfterTime
member.summary: Specifies the time, in milliseconds, after which the transition should start. This setting may be used in conjunction with the advClick attribute. If this attribute is not specified then it is assumed that no auto-advance will occur.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.Speed
member.summary: Specifies the transition speed that is to be used when transitioning from the current slide to the next.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.Value
member.summary: Slide show transition value.

member.summary: Type of transition

member.summary:
Specifies whether or not this sound is a built-in sound. If this attribute is set to true then the generating application is alerted to check the name attribute specified for this sound in it's list of built-in sounds and can then surface a custom name or UI as needed.
Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.SoundName
member.summary:
Specifies a human readable name for the sound of the transition. The property must be assigned to get or set the sound name.
Read-write .
member.remarks: This name appears in the PowerPoint user interface when configuring the transition sound manually.
member.exception: When property is not assigned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideSize.Size
member.summary: Returns or sets the size in points. Read/Write . Assigning any value will reset Type property to and set Orientation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideSize.Type
member.summary: Returns or sets the type of slide size. Read/Write . Assigning any value except will change Size accordingly, but will keep Orientation intact.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideSize.Orientation
member.summary: Returns or sets the slide orientation. Read/Write . Changing this value will swap slide's dimensions.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArt
member.summary: Represents SmartArt object on a slide.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArt.AllNodes
member.summary: Returns collections of all nodes in SmartArt object

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") Dim smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) Dim i As Integer = 0 While i < smart.AllNodes.Count Dim node As SmartArtNode = smart.AllNodes(i) Dim outString As String = String.Format("i = {0}, Text = {1}, Level = {2}, Position = {3}", i, node.TextFrame.Text, node.Level, node.Position) Console.WriteLine(outString) System.Math.Max(System.Threading.Interlocked.Increment(i),i - 1) End While

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArt.Layout
member.summary: Return layout of smartart object

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") For Each shape As Shape In pres.Slides(0).Shapes If TypeOf shape Is SmartArt Then Dim smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) If smart.Layout = SmartArtLayoutType.BasicBlockList Then ...do something End If End If Next

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArt.QuickStyle
member.summary: Return or set quick style of smartart object

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") For Each shape As Shape In pres.Slides(0).Shapes If TypeOf shape Is SmartArt Then Dim smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) If smart.QuickStyle = SmartArtQuickStyleType.BirdsEyeScene Then smart.QuickStyle = SmartArtQuickStyleType.Cartoon End If End If Next

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArt.ColorStyle
member.summary: Return or set color style of smart art object

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") For Each shape As Shape In pres.Slides(0).Shapes If TypeOf shape Is SmartArt Then Dim smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) If smart.ColorStyle = SmartArtColorType.ColoredFillAccent1 Then smart.ColorStyle = SmartArtColorType.TransparentGradientRangeAccent1 End If End If Next

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNode
member.summary: Represents node of SmartArt object

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNode.Remove
member.summary: Remove current node.
member.returns: True if removed succesfully, otherwise false

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") Dim smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) Dim node As SmartArtNode = smart.AllNodes(0) node.Remove()

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNode.ChildNodes
member.summary: Returns collections of all child nodes of the current node Read-only .

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") Dim smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) Dim node0 As SmartArtNode = smart.AllNodes(0); Dim i As Integer = 0 While i < node0.ChildNodes.Count Dim node As SmartArtNode = node0.ChildNodes(i) Dim outString As String = String.Format("i = {0}, Text = {1}, Level = {2}, Position = {3}", i, node.TextFrame.Text, node.Level, node.Position) Console.WriteLine(outString) System.Math.Max(System.Threading.Interlocked.Increment(i),i - 1) End While

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNode.TextFrame
member.summary: Return or set text of the SmartArt node. Read/write

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") Dim smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) Dim node0 As SmartArtNode = smart.AllNodes(0) Dim i As Integer = 0 While i < node0.ChildNodes.Count Dim node As SmartArtNode = node0.ChildNodes(i) Console.WriteLine(node.TextFrame.Text) node.TextFrame.Text = "New text " + i System.Math.Max(System.Threading.Interlocked.Increment(i),i - 1) End While

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNode.IsAssistant
member.summary: Return or set node as assistant. Read/write

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation() Dim slide As SlideE = pres.Slides(0) Dim smart As SmartArt = slide.Shapes.AddSmartArt(0, 0, 400, 400, SmartArtLayoutTypeEx.Hierarchy) For Each node As SmartArtNode In smart.AllNodes If node.IsAssistant Then node.IsAssistant = False End If Next

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNode.Level
member.summary: Nesting level of node Read-only

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") Dim smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) Dim i As Integer = 0 While i < smart.AllNodes.Count If smart.AllNodes(i).Level = 2 Then Console.WriteLine(smart.AllNodes(i).Level + " " + smart.AllNodes(i).TextFrame.Text) End If System.Math.Max(System.Threading.Interlocked.Increment(i),i - 1) End While

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNode.BulletFillFormat
member.summary: Returns the FillFormat object that contains fill formatting properties for a node bullet Read-only . Note: can return null for certain types of SmartArt layout which does not provide bullets for nodes

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNode.Position
member.summary: Zero-based position of node among sibling nodes. Read/write

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") Dim smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) Dim node As SmartArtNode = smart.AllNodes(0) If node.ChildNodes.Count > 3 Then node.ChildNodes(0).Position = node.ChildNodes(0).Position + 1 End If

member.exception: value is less than 0. -or- value is equal to or greater than siblings count

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNodeCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of a SmartArt nodes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNodeCollection.GetNodeByPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get node by position between siblings

example.code: [Visual Basic] Private smart As SmartArt = pres.Slides(0).Shapes.AddSmartArt(0, 0, 400, 400, SmartArtLayoutType.StackedList) Private node As SmartArtNode = smart.AllNodes(0) Private chNode As SmartArtNode = node.ChildNodes.GetNodeByPosition(3)

member.param: Zero-based position
member.returns: First matched node, -or- null if node with this position does not exist

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNodeCollection.AddNode
member.summary: Add new smart art node or sub node.

example.code: [Visual Basic] Private pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") Private smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) Private exNode As SmartArtNode = smart.AllNodes(0) Private newNode As SmartArtNode = exNode.ChildNodes.AddNode()

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNodeCollection.RemoveNode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove node or sub node by index
member.param: Zero-based index of node
member.exception: index is less than 0. -or- index is equal to or greater than siblings count

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNodeCollection.RemoveNode(Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode)
member.summary: Remove node or sub node

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pres As New Presentation("demo.pptx") Dim smart As SmartArt = DirectCast(pres.Slides(0).Shapes(0), SmartArt) If smart.AllNodes.Count > 0 Then Dim node As SmartArtNode = smart.AllNodes(0) smart.AllNodes.RemoveNode(node) End If

member.param: Node to remove

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNodeCollection.RemoveNodeByPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove node from selected position

example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim smart As SmartArt = pres.Slides(0).Shapes.AddSmartArt(0, 0, 400, 400, SmartArtLayoutType.StackedList) Dim node As SmartArtNode = smart.AllNodes(0) If node.ChildNodes.Count >= 5 Then node.ChildNodes.RemoveNodeByPosition(3) End If

member.returns: True if removed successfully, otherwise false

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtNodeCollection.AddNodeByPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Add new node in the selected position of nodes collection

example.code: [Visual Basic] Private smart As SmartArt = pres.Slides(0).Shapes.AddSmartArt(0, 0, 400, 400, SmartArtLayoutType.StackedList) Private node As SmartArtNode = smart.AllNodes(0) Private chNode As SmartArtNode = node.ChildNodes.AddNodeByPosition(2)

member.param: Zero-base node position
member.exception: position is less than 0

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.TabEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents a text's tabulation stop.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.TabEffectiveData.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns:
A 32-bit integer that indicates the relative order of the comparands. The return value has these meanings:
< 0 - This instance is less than obj.
= 0 - This instance is equal to obj.
> 0 - This instance is greater than obj.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TabEffectiveData.Position
member.summary: Returns or sets position of a tab. Assigning this property can change tab's index in collection and invalidate Enumerator. Readonly .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TabEffectiveData.Alignment
member.summary: Returns or sets align style of a tab. Readonly .

member.summary: Removes the encryption.

member.summary: Set write protection for this presentation with specified password.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.EncryptDocumentProperties
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation is password protected. If true then document properties is encrypted in presentation file. If false then document properties is public while presentation is encrypted.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is encrypted.
member.value: true if presentation was loaded from encrypted file or method was called ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.IsOnlyDocumentPropertiesLoaded
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation file is password protected and document properties of this file are public. Value of true means that only document properties are loaded from an encrypted presentation file without use of password. Value of false means that entire encrypted presentation is loaded with use of right password, not only document properties are loaded. If presentation isn't encrypted then property value is always false. If document properties of an encrypted file aren't public then property value is always false. If Presentation.EncryptDocumentProperties is true than IsOnlyDocumentPropertiesLoaded property value is always false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.IsWriteProtected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this presentation is write protected.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.EncryptionPassword
member.summary: Gets the password which is used for presentation encryption.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.StreamWrapper.WriteByte(System.Byte)
